reviews.review_msg: TA is really good, but the final paper sucks.

I did not enjoy his lectures and teaching style: lecture is too long, the slides are heavy; too many readings and tough grading on commentaries. He seems passionate about his course, but his teaching style is very boring. In addition to that, his take home final exam is very difficult. Be ready to read and write a lot and to face with tough marking

Shane is really a great professor. He is passionate about his subject, very well organized and he, as well as his guest speakers, are very interesting. He is not an easy marker. Therefore, prepare to work hard and attend each class.

Very good prof. He's good at making his statements clear and because of that, makes the 3 hour lecture just a bit more tolerable. Too bad the whole concept on the environment is difficult to grasp making this course somewhat daunting. Would love to see him teach other topics.

Bob is a cool professor with tons of knowledge - my only thing is he tends to go off topic and lectures feel really really long sometimes. Lots of papers to write and reading responses but those aren't that hard.

Bob is enthusiastic and extremely passionate about the environment and communication. However, lectures are quite heavy with many topics and it's a little overwhelming as there's a lot of course concepts - some are hard to grasp.  This is the only class I ever had to see my TA for extra help. Workload is normal though.

She speaks in monotone and does not seem to prepare her lectures very carefully. It's difficult to pay attention to or take interest in what she says. It's a communication course and she doesn't excel at communicating.

I'm surprised by the ratings for Svitlana. I had taken CMNS349 due to the lack of prereqs so I didn't have much of a choice in the upper division cmns courses but it ended up being not only my best grade in the semester but also my favourite course. I think Svitlana is really passionate plus the course had extra credit for participation in class.

Whatever you do, don't take a class with this prof. She is terribly disorganized and requires an insane amount of reading. She does not answer the student's questions clearly and her slides are absolutely useless. Honestly, she shouldn't ever teach again

Svitlana will open your eyes and blow your mind. Her passion for the topics is apparent from her real-life experiences working as a researcher and writer of cyberwar, security, global capitalism, and nuclear heritage. You will leave every lecture with a head full of inspiration and curiosity. Highly recommend her classes!!
